|topic=World history |dykdate=28 April 2012 |dykentry=... that in 1204, the wife of '''[[Hugh de Neville]]''' paid [[John, King of England]] 200 chickens for the right to sleep one night with her own husband? |currentstatus=FA |four=yes }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Biography |living=no |class=FA |military-work-group=yes |military-priority=low |listas=Neville, Hugh De }} {{WikiProject Middle Ages|class=FA|Crusades-task-force=yes}} {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|Biography=y|British=y|Crusades=y|Medieval=y}}}} == Milhist ==
Any objection to a Milhist tag? I don't plan to tag every medieval article, but it looks like there's a connection here. - Dank ([[User talk:Dank|push to talk]]) 17:23, 13 May 2012 (UTC) : No objection. Although there is one for the crusades task force as you can see above... [[User:Ealdgyth|Ealdgyth]] - [[User talk:Ealdgyth|Talk]] 17:25, 13 May 2012 (UTC) ::Oops. - Dank ([[User talk:Dank|push to talk]]) 18:15, 13 May 2012 (UTC)
== bad data == "Neville stated in 1298 that over the previous six and a half years the amount raised by the various revenues of the forests had been £15,000;[18] in 1212 it had been £4,486.[17] " Since de Neville died in 1234, the dates in this snippet must be wrong. Go back to your sources and make sure you copy correctly this time. [[Special:Contributions/108.18.136.147|108.18.136.147]] ([[User talk:108.18.136.147|talk]]) 12:55, 3 August 2015 (UTC)
